programme.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
programme.desc: Three aliens (Jim Carrey, Damon Wayans and Jeff Goldblum) crash-land in Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley. A manicurist (Geena Davis) and her boss (Julie Brown) befriend the threesome, give them makeovers and showing them the town.

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton (Guy Pearce of MOMENTO) heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn (Don Cheadle of CRASH).

programme.title: 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag
programme.desc: Hit man Tommy Spinelli (Joe Pesci) is traveling to San Diego to deliver a bag of eight "former associates" to an angry mob boss. But when a fellow traveler, Charlie (Andy Comeau), mistakenly takes the bag, the heads go to Baja! Spinelli desperately tries to find Charlie, and Charlie is trying to get the bag's macabre contents back across the border. Who will wind up with the heads? And who might lose his? Only one thing's for sure...they'll both have to use their noggins to get out of this one!

programme.title: Thelma & Louise
programme.desc: In one of the greatest road movies of all time, Geena Davis and Susan Sarandon ride to everlasting fame as two women who embark on a crime spree across the American southwest.

programme.title: Before We Go
programme.desc: BEFORE WE GO, the directorial debut of Chris Evans, follows the journey of two strangers stuck in New York City for the night.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Wounded" - A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Hidden Killers" - When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Playing With Fire" - Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Bite" - Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Circumstances" - Dario Romano is found dead by his son at the bottom of the attic ladder. What happened to this 45-year-old? With Dr. G's guidance, Dr. Stephany must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Encounters" - Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Redemption" - An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Portlandia:Fashion
programme.desc: Portland's Dollar Store recruits Quinn as the face for their rebranding campaign. Spyke faces trial for making unlicensed Bart Simpson merchandise. Guest starring Ed Begley Jr., Matt Groening, and Oscar the Grouch.

programme.title: Portlandia:Doug Becomes a Feminist
programme.desc: Doug discovers that he is a male feminist. Sandra takes a rideshare for the first time. Guest starring Greta Gerwig and Graham Wagner.

programme.title: Portlandia:House for Sale
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie's landlord moves into their house. Kath and Dave look to buy a new home for their next renovation project. Guest starring Steve Buscemi and Anna Gunn.

programme.title: Portlandia:You Can Call Me Al
programme.desc: Kath and Dave scramble to rehearse for a karaoke party. Guest starring Vanessa Bayer, Jeff Goldblum, and Paul Simon.

programme.title: Portlandia:Dead Pets
programme.desc: Police begin profiling weirdos after arsonists burn down a taxidermy shop. Guest starring Paul Reubens and Olivia Wilde.

programme.title: Portlandia:Pickathon
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. The Flaming Lips headline Portland's Pickathon Music Festival. Brendan and Michelle attend the festival via drone. Two concertgoers go boy-crazy. Guest starring Alia Shawkat, Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Portlandia:Going Gray
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Fred wakes up with gray hair and sets out on a journey to find out how old he is. Carrie is faced with a life decision. Guest starring Kyle MacLachlan, Natasha Lyonne, Mitchell Hurwitz and Kumail Nanjiani.

programme.title: Portlandia:Shville
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Fred wants to do something big with his life so he moves to Austin. Carrie is surprised when unexpected guests arrive and she finally experiences motherhood. Guest starring Alia Shawkat & Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Portlandia:Weirdo Beach
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. The Weirdos decide to go to the beach but are stalled when their hearse breaks down. An office worker is annoyed that everyone is using his brand new charger. Guest starring Glenn Danzig.

programme.title: Portlandia:Breaking Up
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Claire is finally fed up with Doug's childish behavior and breaks up with him. They both date new people and discover surprising things about themselves.

programme.title: Portlandia:TADA
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Kath & Dave feel marginalized after an accident leaves them temporarily disabled. A car service app user dodges surge pricing by calling a cab. Joey gets an internship.

programme.title: Portlandia:First Feminist City
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Portland is declared the most feminist city in the country, and Toni and Candace have to deal with the attention. The town opens a Femi-Mart.

programme.title: Portlandia:Lance is Smart
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. Lance gets glasses and joins an intellectual crowd. Nina hires a tutor to help her win over Lance's new friends.

programme.title: Portlandia:Noodle Monster
programme.desc: Starring Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein. A tsukemen ramen monster is on the loose in Portland. The mayor tries to impress a major brand visiting Portland and enlists Fred and Carrie to help. Guest starring Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Portlandia:The Storytellers
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie consult with a storytelling expert. A traveler checks into an unconventional hotel. The weirdos discover Bed, Bath and Beyond.

programme.title: Portlandia:Carrie Dates a Hunk
programme.desc: Fred doesn't dig Carrie's hunky new beau. A new couple goes to therapy. Drew and Andy question, "What about men?" Melanie and Lars make the important choice to buy a rug.

programme.title: Portlandia:Fred's Cell Phone Company
programme.desc: Fred's new business may be more trouble than it's worth. Kate and Sam learn the perils of long distance love. Drew and Andy plan a funeral. Nina gives Lance a massage chair that changes everything.

programme.title: Portlandia:Separation Anxiety
programme.desc: Toni and Candace retire but there is still some unfinished business between them. Drew and Andy re-imagine gingerbread cookies. Peter and Nance try a new protein diet. The rats consider the charms of squirrels.

programme.title: Portlandia:Amore
programme.desc: Fred has a marriage arranged. A couple opens a movie theater with a real at-home experience. A school hires a bully to teach children grit. A creepy guy keeps commenting "Beautiful" on social media posts.

programme.title: Portlandia:Friend Replacement
programme.desc: Carrie looks for a new friend. Jill's office anxieties cause her to try a radical diet. Drew and Andy host a film festival. A scientist pitches the cure for modern life. Ghavin opens an elaborate box set.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:DC Benny - You Don't Look Funny
programme.desc: Benny lives in Brooklyn where he fiddles around with old Land Rovers when he is supposed to be helping his wife run her natural skincare business. He has a dog named Grits and two cats who prefer that he not share their personal information in this bio.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Danny Villalpando - Too Informative
programme.desc: Danny has been performing stand up comedy for over sixteen years. He’s had the opportunity to work for many corporate events, charity organizations, and cruise ships. He has also had the privilege of working worldwide with the USO and Comic’s on Duty. His comedy has taken him such places as Japan, Singapore, Afghanistan, Panama, Honduras, Greenland, Iraq, Italy, and Greece.... just to name a few! In addition to headlining comedy clubs across the United States, Danny has also performed on television seventeen times. He’s been seen on NBC’s “Friday Night” as well as “The Latino Laugh Festival” and Comedy Central. Danny’s acting talents were also displayed as a bartender, on NBC’s “Meet My Folk’s.” Most recently he completed an independent film with Second City called "Time Share." Most of Danny’s comedy is based on his life experiences. Comedy fans described his act as the type of act you could do anywhere. From a bar, to corporate, it’s just funny!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Corey Rodrigues - People Whisperer
programme.desc: Corey is a highly sought after national touring college, club and corporate and cruise ship performer. He was the winner of The Catch a New Rising Star, The Funniest Comic in New England and the 2017 Big Sky Comedy Festivals. Rodrigues has been featured on the hilarious Gotham Live, Laughs on Fox and True Tv's Laff Mobbs Laff Tracks television shows and currently can be heard on Sirius XM. He combines comedy from his own life and the lives of those around him. Mix that with a hilarious point of view and he's able to talk about just about anything.

programme.title: Key Lewis - Half Black, Half White, Looks Mexican
programme.desc: Sacramento California born Key Lewis is a high energy, improvisational, storytelling, multiple-personality nutcase! His love for the people and hunger for the stage is his undying motivation. His comedic stories about his interracial childhood, family, and unusual views on relationships, make Key simply a joy to watch. His ability to improvise and interact with all types of crowds makes this up and coming comic and actor one to look out for. Key Lewis has appeared on Marlon Wayans TBSís Funniest Wins, Starz Networks StaannDup, Kevin Harts One Mic Stand as well as Bill Bellamyís Whoís Got Jokes! Key says, chase your dream, always know your audience donít act funny, be funny... donít worry about the quantity of your material but the quality the sooner you create a relationship with your crowd, the better you will be. Television: Bill Bellamyís Whoís Got Jokes on TVONE. BETíS One Mic Stand Hosted by Kevin Hart. Starz Network Comedy Series called StaannDup, Marlon Wayanís TBSís Funniest Wins! Competitions: Winner of the 2013 Rocky Mountain Laugh Off, Finalist in the 2010 Bay Area Black Comedy Competition, Semi-Finalist 2009 San Francisco International Comedy Competition, a Semi-Finalist in the 2008 Boston Comedy Festival, 2007 Seattle International Comedy Competition Finalist, Shades of Laughs Portland Oregon Winner, TVONE Bill Bellamyís Who Got Jokeís Contestant. Radio: Improv work with FM Morning Shows (Top 40 Radio): KSFM 102.5 (Sacramento, CA), KWOD 106.5 (Sacramento, CA) KWIN 97.7 ñ Stockton/Lodi, CA, Mix 107.9 Salt Lake City UT (Is It Racist Segment) & The Man Panel. Concerts/Festivals: Opened for Jon B. and Keysha Cole, Taste Of Tacoma, & Bite Of Seattle Fountain Stage 5 Years Running! Key Lewis has worked with the likes of Kevin Hart, Pablo Francisco, Sam Bam, Alonzo Bodden, Jay London, Gabriel Iglesias, Brooks McBeth, Tommy Davidson, Katt Williams, De-Ray Davis, Andrew Norelli, Lonnie Love, Jeff Garcia, Damon Wayans, Joey Diaz, Guy Torry, Darren Carter, Paul Mooney, Kermet Apio and many more.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Dennis Regan - Dennisland
programme.desc: The King Of Queens writer Dennis Regan comes swinging hard with his quick wit and flawless delivery. The laughs just keep on coming in "Dennisland".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Adam Cozens - Anyway...Here's Adam Cozens
programme.desc: A hilarious performer, Adam has been seen on IFC’s “The Birthday Boys,” HBO’s “Got No Game,” and TBS’s “Lopez Tonight.” His stand up has been featured on Nickelodeon’s “NickMom,” Hulu’s “West Coast Funnies” “Tell Your Friends: The Concert Film,” “The CoExist Comedy Tour” documentary, “ComedyTime,” as well as heard worldwide on Sirius|XM Radio.

programme.title: Lee Hardin - Not Quite a Grown-Up
programme.desc: Lee Hardin is a comedian known for making bad decisions and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jason Russell - Beige Frosty
programme.desc: Like most comedians, finding a way to be silly in class was a way to get attention from classmates and teachers! Some teachers were amused others had no sense of humor.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Cam Bertrand - Sophisticated Ignorance
programme.desc: Cam shares his outlook on relationships and life through the eyes of a 23-year-old in a way that everyone can relate to. Bringing high energy and witty style that appeals to a wide demographic.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Mike Toomey - Welcome to My World
programme.desc: With his Sharp Delivery, quick wit, and unique style, Mike Toomey has been a favorite at comedy clubs and special events since 1982. A Daily performer on The WGN Morning News in Chicago, Mike has appeared in concert with such names as George Carlin, Wayne Newton, Crosby, Stills & Nash, and Reba McIntyre. He has performed on numerous television programs including HBO's U.S. Comedy Arts Festival in Aspen Colorado MTV's Half Hour Comedy Hour and A&E's Comedy on the Road. The Chicago Tribune calls Mike, "One of the funniest and most talented performers to ever work in Chicago." For an evening of uncontrollable laughs, Mike Toomey is a sure choice!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Christian Pieper - Glutton for Punishment
programme.desc: Christian Pieper is an award-winning and crowd-pleasing comedian from Beaver Dam, Kentucky, now living in Los Angeles. In just five years as a performer, Christian has quickly earned acclaim for his honest, smart, and welcoming approach to personal material, layering unexpectedly subversive observations on current events, culture, and relationships.A two-time semifinalist in the prestigious Boston Comedy Festival, hes also been featured in the Crossroads Comedy Festival, Burbank Comedy Festival, and other festivals and competitions across the country. Christian has also performed abroad, having done shows for troops and civilians in eight different countries, and was a guest on the Bob & Tom show. He currently hosts and produces Adrenaline, a comedy-challenge show presented regularly at Wiseguys Comedy Club in Salt Lake City and the Hollywood Improv.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we invite the ladies to throw down on the battle stage! Radio host, Laura Stylez, says her sneaker game can hang with the best of them, meanwhile we also invited our first ever international battler, Anna Bediones, to come showcase some of her exquisite footwear. These ladies definitely held their own, showcasing a variety of stylish and exclusive sneakers!

programme.title: Tyron Woodley Crowns the West Coast's Best Rapper | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: UFC Champion Tyron Woodley is also known for dabbing in music himself, so his deep knowledge of hip hop came as a surprise to no one. The Ferguson, Missouri native stopped by Complex Brackets to pick who he thinks is the best West Coast rapper and was faced with some difficult choices between legendary figures with some newer rappers trying to make a name for themselves. Watch him struggle to pick between Snoop vs Ice Cube, Tupac vs E-40 and Schoolboy Q vs Too Short.

programme.title: Tinashe Wants All the Smoke in Quarantine
programme.desc: Check out the second episode featuring Tinashe, as she reveals how she's taking on all "challenges" from Tik Tok to Instagram and PS4 while quarantined!

programme.title: T.I. Breaks Down What the Harris Household Is Binge-Watching
programme.desc: T.I. reveals his favorite Verzuz battles on IG Live, the story behind his podcast "Expeditiously With Tip T.I. Harris," and how his family doesn't like to lose.

programme.title: Foodgod on the New 'Kardashians' Season and His Delivery Go-tos
programme.desc: Foodgod Jonathan Cheban reveals his favorite food deliveries during the pandemic and his new seafood delivery service 'Oceanbox.' He also reflects on how watching himself on KUWTK this season has reminded him of his regular life.

programme.title: Lil Yachty vs Conceited in a Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this heavyweight Sneaker Battle From Home episode, we put "Mr. Slow It Down I Just Dissed You", Conceited, up against rapper, singer, songwriter, Lil Yachty, in a 5 round sneaker battle of epic proportions! I won't spoil anything for the viewers but a lot of back and forth took place along with tons of hilarity! Watch the episode and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Allen Iverson Reminds Us Why He's The Best Dressed NBA Player Ever | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown," we're live from ComplexCon 2019 in Long Beach with special guest and NBA style legend Allen Iverson! In addition to discussing which NBA players were the best and worst dressed of the week, we take a look at some of A.I's past fits while in the league and discuss the influence he still has on current player's fashion. Iverson also tells stories about the backlash he received for not sticking to the NBA's former uniform dress code, plus more!

programme.title: James Harden's Cozy Fit Costs as Much as a New Car | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this episode of 'Tunnel Takedown,' the hosts talk PJ Tucker's latest outfit, how players tone down their fits in smaller cities, the '90s Starter jacket trend still being in style today, and Racks Hogan explains his beef with Amiri. They even try to guess the costs of outfits from superstars like James Harden and Ben Simmons. The numbers may surprise you.

programme.title: NikeStories vs Nick Engvall in a Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we put two OG's in the sneaker space against one another. In one corner we have Drew Hammell, also known as NikeStories, and in the other corner we have founder of "Sneaker History" and veteran writer in the sneaker blog space, Nick Engvall. These two go head to head in a versatile five round battle! We get to see some classic gems, we haven't seen in a while. Check it out for yourselves and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Dating My Mother
programme.desc: Unemployed and living in his New Jersey hometown, brash screenwriter Danny spends his days practicing yoga, sipping red wine, and power-walking with his mother Joan. But when she reveals she's seeing another man, their version of domestic bliss comes crashing down. DATING MY MOTHER follows the intimate and tumultuous relationship between a single mother and her gay son as they navigate the dizzying world of online dating. While they search for their versions of Mr. Right, mother and son discover that sometimes you need to be apart in order to grow together.

programme.title: Engaged
programme.desc: ENGAGED is a short romantic comedy that follows Darren (Daniel K. Isaac), who keeps trying - and failing - to propose to his boyfriend Elliot (Ryan Jamaal Swain). When their relationship is put into an uncomfortable spotlight during a friend's outrageous engagement party, Darren realizes he actually might be self-sabotaging himself due to unresolved insecurities about his sexuality.

programme.title: I Do
programme.desc: A gay Briton living in New York risks losing his family and residency in the United States. He marries a lesbian friend to remain in the country, but things get complicated when he meets the love of his life.↵

programme.title: Querencia
programme.desc: Teka has just broken up with her boyfriend and left home for the first time to follow her dream of becoming a dancer. The big city, and the big city talent she competes with at auditions, have left her feeling very lonely. Enter: dating apps. When Teka mistakenly selects "women seeking women" on her profile, she meets Abe, a struggling musician who needs to move on from her ex, which might just be the happiest of accidents.

programme.title: Strut
programme.desc: In each episode of Strut, we watch Eddie and her friends transform through their risky new endeavor in unexpected positive ways. Eddie is a geeky porn editor whose low self-confidence has turned her into a 26-year-old hermit. Her friends, Eva (an unemployed artist), Lucy (an intern), and Chandaleer (a trainwreck/fashion model) vow to save her from her unhealthy solitude. When the friends decide to start a high-end escorting agency to earn more money, they convince skeptical Eddie to help them build their business and lift her self-esteem. Together they successfully navigate the adrenaline-fueled escorting industry with Eddie as their CEO and fellow sex worker.

programme.title: South Beach On Heels

programme.title: Howl
programme.desc: Allen Ginsberg is a poet, counter-culture adventurer and chronicler of the Beat Generation. In his famously confessional style, Ginsberg recounts his life and search for personal liberation that led to the most timeless and electrifying work of his career, the poem HOWL. Meanwhile, in a San Francisco courtroom, HOWL is on trial. Prosecutor Ralph McIntosh sets out to prove that the book should be banned, while defense attorney Jake Ehrlich argues for freedom of speech and creative expression.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'The Bees Are So Angry, Part 2" - Five teams of two compete for $100,000 dollars on a five stunt, 2 hour spectacular as they are flown underneath the belly of a helicopter, have to eat bees, are launched off a building through glass, deal with the horror of bull testicles and drive a car through the back of a moving semi truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'Leeches & Shaved Heads & Tear Gas, Part 1" - In a special 2 hour Fear Factor five teams of 2 are bungied off a cliff while tied under a helicopter, must eat leeches, must run through a burning building, deal with the Wheel of Misfortune, and finally grab flags off a moving car while dangling of a crane. All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'Leeches & Shaved Heads & Tear Gas, Part 2" - In a special 2 hour Fear Factor five teams of 2 are bungied off a cliff while tied under a helicopter, must eat leeches, must run through a burning building, deal with the Wheel of Misfortune, and finally grab flags off a moving car while dangling of a crane. All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Snake Bite" - Four couples compete for a grand prize of $50,000. In order to win they must face getting catapulted off the top of a tall building, transfer snakes with theirs mouths and transfers flags to a partner hanging under a helicopter, all while riding a personal watercraft.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Roach Coach" - Four teams of two compete for $50,000 as they are locked in a cage and sunk underwater, eat a disgusting meal from the Fear Factor Roach Coach consisting of roaches, grasshoppers, blood salsa and maggots and lastly must leap back and forth from a moving station wagon onto a bus.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Broken Hearts & Blood Baths" - Four teams of exes must deal with 3 stunts and each other. In order to win $50,000 they must launch a car into a lake while being strapped in, dive for cow hearts in thousands of gallons of blood, and deal with the most difficult Fear Factor stunt ever as they run, fly, swim and climb while trying to blow up a fueling station.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Tall Crappacino" - Four teams of two attempt to win $50,000. They face three extreme stunts as they are stuck in a car being flown under two helicopters, must drink a Fear Factor Crappacino and lastly are dropped through a collapsing tower.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Scorpion Tales" - Four teams of family members compete for $50,000 as they careen into a quarry full of live ammunition while in the back of a truck, must devour nasty scorpions, and are strapped to the front of a cement truck as it smashes through structures.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Descender Jump, Eat Sheep's Eye, Water Tank" - Contestants are asked to jump from a 12th floor window in a hotel underwater challenge.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Dog Attack, Snake Pit, Beam Walk" - Contestants brave a dog attack, submerge themselves in a tank full of snakes and traverse a beam 100 feet in the air.

programme.desc: David Voisey chases big bucks in his home state of Ohio and travels to Kansas for the rut where he encounters the biggest buck of his life!

programme.title: BOWHUNTING Rival Wild S6:E2 "Getting The Shakes"
programme.desc: While in Kansas, Casey Keefer uncovers a big piece of the ‘Shakes’ puzzle, honing in on where he’s living. In Ohio Chris Keefer and Jason Brown hunt a front that has the deer on their feet.

programme.title: Rival Wild S6:E3 "Dog Bone"
programme.desc: DOG BONE - Luck strikes Deer Camp in Ohio as Jason Brown finds himself in the right place at the right time.

programme.title: Rival Wild S6:E4 "Hang and Bang"
programme.desc: In Ohio Chris Keefer gets a bead on a mystery buck and elects to make a move with a HANG & BANG setup to see if he can get out in front of him. On a different side of the farm, Cody Keefer is still after his first buck. Meanwhile, Casey Keefer is in Kansas still pursuing Shakes and Bob Marley, slowly honing in on Bob's home territory.

programme.title: Lunkerville S13:E7 "The Fishin Musician"
programme.desc: Adirondack music legend and avid bass fisherman Rich Ortiz takes Mike D spring bass fishing in upstate New York. Conditions in April see water temps in the 40’s as the two use jigs and flukes to target staging fish.

programme.title: Lunkerville S13:E8 "Fishmore and Dolittle"

programme.title: Lunkerville S13:E9 "The Junkman and Mrs. Ota"
programme.desc: Japanese expats Kaz and Izumi Ota take Mike D bass fishing on Memorial Day weekend on Lake Hopatcong, New Jersey. Kaz is jazzed and Izumi is cool while a Texas-rigged creature bait is all the 3 need to catch spring largemouth.

programme.desc: Nick joins local colorful characters Dave Showell and Brian Donohue to target back bay white perch and to rake fresh cherrystone clams in the backyard of the infamous Jersey Devil.

programme.title: Steak and Potatoes
programme.desc: Purchase a good steak and cook it properly, and all it needs is salt and pepper-and, of course, a side of spuds. Unfortunately, many of the inexpensive steaks labeled "great for grilling'' at the supermarket turn out tough and dry with little flavor. And mashed potatoes are often gluey or runny. We wanted potatoes with perfect texture and big flavor-something unusual to accompany a great steak and a good bottle of wine.

programme.title: Pad Thai and Sesame Noodles
programme.desc: The test kitchen shows you how to make Pad Thai and Sesame Noodles with Shredded Chicken.

programme.title: More Italian Classics
programme.desc: Pasta all'amatriciana is perhaps Rome's most famous dish. Despite the fancy name, it's nothing more than long-strand pasta sauced with tomatoes, onion, bacon, and hot pepper flakes and dusted with cheese. This simple dish is about the details, and we knew they could be mastered.

programme.title: Regional Classics
programme.desc: Some local dishes become so popular that they transcend their region. Gumbo is a taste of Louisiana in a big old bowl. And Cincinnati chili is American original, served with buttered spaghetti, kidney beans, cheddar cheese, and chopped onions. Our goal when developing our versions of these dishes was to remain faithful to the originals while making the recipes approachable for cooks who may not have grown up with them.

programme.title: Cookies
programme.desc: In this episode we make two cookies from opposite ends of the spectrum: thick oatmeal and the dainty spritz.

programme.title: Let's Talk Turkey
programme.desc: Thanksgiving can strike fear into the heart of even the most proficient cook. First, there's the turkey to contend with-in no other meal is the main course paraded in front of guests with as much fanfare. Sweet potato casserole is often considered another must-have. With our recipes for these Thanksgiving standards, we minimize the work so that the cook can enjoy the holiday as much as everyone else.

programme.title: Favorite Citrus Desserts
programme.desc: Lemon Bundt cake, glazed with a snowy white icing, is a simple, elegant dessert. But time and again, we find it lacking in lemon flavor. Key lime pie is another favorite citrus dessert, but transporting this pie, which has a delicate, wobbly filling, can be difficult. We set out to solve both these problems.

programme.title: Dark Chocolate Desserts
programme.desc: In this episode, we set out to develop ultimate versions of two favorite chocolate desserts: chocolate mousse and chocolate cupcakes.

programme.title: Aloha State Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof prepares Hawaiian-Style Fried Chicken with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews plastic wrap with host Julia Collin Davison. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of potato chips. Finally, test cook Natalie Estrada makes Julia an Aloha State favorite, Hawaiian Macaroni Salad.

programme.title: Roast Beef and Potatoes
programme.desc: Test cook Natalie Estrada reveals the secrets to making a foolproof Classic Roast Beef Tenderloin with host Bridget Lancaster. Next, host Julia Collin Davison discovers equipment expert Adam Ried's top pick of tongs. Finally, test cook Lawman Johnson shows Julia how to make perfect Lyonnaise Potatoes.

programme.title: Smoky Barbecue Favorites
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to tackle Texas-sized, Thick Cut Smoked Pork Chops. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his pick for dry measuring cups. Finally, Julia Collin Davison reveals the secret to achieving the perfect Backyard Barbecue Beans.

programme.title: Plenty of Garlic and Parm
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster shows host Julia Collin Davison the steps to preparing the Central California regional favorite, Garlic Fried Chicken. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his pick for the best inexpensive Dutch oven on the market. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore prepares an unforgettable fan-requested dish for host Bridget Lancaster, Crispy Parmesan Potatoes.

programme.title: Summer Steak and Salad
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Bridget Lancaster the ultimate Grilled Thick-Cut Porterhouse Steaks. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top pick for paring knives. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of crumbled blue cheese. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Julia the best Caesar Green Beans.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make a Lone Star State classic-Flank Steak in Adobo. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for inexpensive blenders. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Julia how to make the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Baked Alaska Showstopper
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster head into the test kitchen to uncover the secrets to making the ultimate Baked Alaska at home. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews ice cream machines in the Equipment Corner. Next, science expert Dan Souza reveals the science of insulation and thermodynamics at work in Baked Alaska. And finally, gadget expert Lisa McManus shares the best offset spatulas.

programme.title: Comfort Classics
programme.desc: Julia makes the Best Roast Chicken With Root Vegetables and Dan Souza makes Almost No-Knead Sourdough Bread.

programme.title: Modern Weeknight Meals
programme.desc: Modern Weeknight Meals Test cook Becky Hays makes Bridget the perfect One-Hour Broiled Chicken and Pan Sauce. In the Equipment Corner, expert Adam Ried reviews blenders, and then test cook Tim Chin wraps up the episode by making Julia the ultimate Modern Cauliflower Gratin.

programme.title: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: Happy holidays! Join the America's Test Kitchen cast as they share their favorite holiday recipes and memories.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - Mexamericana
programme.desc: Pati’s family is the perfect example of cultures colliding – Mexican and American. The happy result is the creation of unique and tasty recipes. Pati dives deep into the blending of these cultures and comes up with some classic American recipes that have a delicious Mexican twist. She also takes us to a local restaurant where she learns the owner’s own unique Mex-American story.

programme.title: From Scratch - Hamburgers
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe visits a butcher to find the perfect meats to make hot dogs and BURGERS.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Monticello Wine Experiment
Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Sweet Nectar
programme.desc: In the remote reaches of Mexico, we learn how the world’s first organic fair trade honey is harvested. Chef Richard Sandoval, famed for his modern Mexican cuisine, wields a coa axe to show us how to tap the rare blue agave for its sweet syrup. With local ingredients in hand, it’s back to the kitchen where three generations of Sandoval’s prepare a Mexican feast with these sweet nectars.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Street Food Chronicles
programme.desc: Just like the entire continent of Asia, street food is hugely popular in Korea and many of the most beloved dishes in the country come from street carts and stands. On this episode, Marja and Jean-Georges eat street food all over the peninsula, including silkworm larvae, hoddeok, sweet pancakes filled with peanuts and sugar and Dragon’s Beard, a candy made of stretched honey and nuts.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Anne Kearney, Bob Waggoner, and Frank Stitt
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Smoked Salmon Terrine, Seared Red Leg Partridge with Ravioli of Foie Gras, and Blackberry Cobbler. Restaurants include: Peristyle in New Orleans, Wild Boar Restaurant in Nashville, and Highlands Bar & Grill in Birmingham.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Comfort Food
programme.desc: Stumped for meal ideas? Let Martin inspire you with his special take on some popular favourites!

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - The Spice Garden
programme.desc: Singapore was once a major seaport during the height of the spice trade. Martin picks spices from the garden of his friend Kwan Liu who has a cooking school here. They use the spices to prepare dishes with the fresh ingredients they found at the Tiong Bahru Market. This episode's recipes include: Double-Ginger Fish, Egg-Flower Soup with Lemongrass and Mushrooms, and Fluffy Cloud in Lime Syrup.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Monticello Wine Experiment
Dine & Dish Nation - Brome Modern Eatery Coop Caribbean Fusion Otus Supply
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Nathan Hochstein, Mari Nafsou and Mary Burkhardt, who review melt-in-your-mouth burgers and other favorites at the Brome Modern Eatery signature Caribbean and Asian specialties from celebrity Chef Max Hardy at the Coop Caribbean Fusion and upscale eats of pork, fish, boar and more at Otus Supply.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Jumbo Pot Stickers
programme.desc: Bundles of chopped shrimp, shiitake mushrooms and ginger are wrapped in dough and served with a lime and green onion dipping sauce. Leftovers create the base for a spicy soup.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Old Salts, Young Guns
programme.desc: When cousins Ryan and Travis Croxton revitalized the long formant family oyster business, they thought it would be a side gig. Today, they lead the nation’s bi-valve resurgence. Chef Jason Alley and his two kids head out on the Bay to harvest the bi‐valves and get a course in marine biology and learn how the oyster is playing a big part in cleaning up the Bay.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Pork Chronicles
programme.desc: As opposed to the lean-is-better preference in America, Koreans love their pork full of fat and, incidentally, full of flavor. On this episode, Marja, her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, and an expert food blogger named Daniel eat classic pork barbeque at Heukdonga restaurant in Seoul made with Jeju’s famous black pigs.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: James Burns, Hallman Woods III, and Sebastien Canonne
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pan-fried Green Tomatoes, Grilled Duck Breast with Wild Rice, and Passion Fruit Creme Brulee and Pineapple Tuile. Restaurants include: J. Bistro in Mt. Pleasant, Le Rosier in New Iberia, and The Ritz-Carlton in Chicago.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Pomegranate
programme.desc: Watch Chef Staib make Roasted Salmon with Avocado and Pomegranate Seeds, a Quinoa Pomegranate Salad as well.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Spicing Up Rice

programme.desc: Nathan installs a barn door Tom compares roofing materials Mark installs a drywell.

programme.title: Nursery Paint, Record Stand | Ask TOH
programme.desc: Mauro paints a nursery Richard tests a new dryer Tom and Kevin build a record stand.

programme.desc: Tom repairs a built-in with hand tools Heath Eastman installs a light in a dining room.

programme.title: Polybutylene, Squeaky Door | Ask TOH

programme.title: (Ad Optimize) Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Pass Through, New Gate
programme.desc: The thirteenth season of Ask This Old House begins with Richard showing Kevin some solutions for dealing with rust staining. Tom opens up a small home by installing a pass through in a load-bearing wall. Roger replaces a poorly built fence gate with one that will last. And the guys play "What Is It" with special guest NASA Astronaut Rick Mastracchio.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Citrus Greening, Tile
programme.desc: Roger heads to Florida to learn about Citrus Greening, a disease that's killing citrus trees across the state. Tom replaces an old vinyl peel-and-stick floor with ceramic tile. And the guys ask ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Front Door, Faucet Fix
programme.desc: Roger educates Kevin on beneficial insects. Tom resizes a front door that gets stuck on carpet every time it opens. Richard repairs an outdoor garden faucet. And the guys ask ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Special Drought Show
programme.desc: In this special episode, the guys tackle practical solutions for drought. Kevin and Richard tour Lake Mead, the largest reservoir in the country. Roger visits Las Vegas to replace a water-guzzling lawn. Kevin meets with Meteorologist Jim Cantore to hear cautionary tales from the front lines of the drought. And Richard travels to San Francisco to replace an old-fashioned toilet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Beam Fix, New Switch
programme.desc: Tom teaches a homeowner how to repair some structural problems in his home. Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner run wiring for a new ceiling fixture and switch in a living room. And the guys ask, ""What is it?"

programme.title: Flipping San Diego:Crack House
programme.desc: Chief tries to keep his outlook sunny and relaxed but Chris's latest find is putting even his laid back attitude to the test. This La Mesa hillside ranch is literally sliding down a slope. The deck is hanging on by a nail--and the foundation is crumbling! As each fix leads to new problems and bigger overages, the stress soon causes cracks in communications. Will this house splinter the foundation of our flippers? Or will Chief and Chris dig deep and rehab their way to a big payday?

programme.title: Flipping San Diego:Tiny Tiny House

Can Chief pull enough design tricks out of his architectural hat to captivate some buyers? Or will this clown house drive Chris crazy?

To speed the renovations, the pair split the houses setting off a competition over who's the fastest flipper--until Elisa stages an intervention with hedge clippers! Will these partners remember they must work together to succeed? Or will this "Double Trouble" boil over into flipping failure?

programme.desc: "Season 7, 4 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The four chefs must teach bachelors with no cooking experience how to prepare monkfish. The winner and a chosen guest get to ride on a Goodyear blimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 4 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The last four chefs taste dishes at the Savoy Grill, then must recreate one. The winner spends time with their family on a yach while the losers clean the dormitories.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 7, 2 Chefs Compete" - In the season finale, the final two chefs travel to the London West Hollywood to be judged by five of Gordon Ramsay's top chefs.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 15 Chefs Compete" - Chef Gordon Ramsay returns for a fourth season of culinary torture. Fifteen chefs will compete for the chance to work at Ramsay's own restaurant in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 14 Chefs Compete" - The season's first challenge finds the contestants slicing halibut into thin six-ounce fillets. One member of each team must serve as maître d' during the dining service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 13 Chefs Compete" - After chickens wake them up in their living quarters, the contestants must pluck what once clucked, then cook them for the evening's family-style dinner service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Park's Edge
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay stops at Park's Edge in Atlanta, where he finds a chaotic kitchen and severe signs of mismanagement.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Spin a Yarn
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits a fifty-year-old steakhouse. Despite the restaurant's rich history, it's long overdue for a visual and culinary makeover.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Charlie's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay pays Charlie's a visit. Located in La Verne, California, this Italian eatery suffers from a lackluster menu and outdated décor.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Cafe Hon
programme.desc: When a quaint Baltimore café suffers a public image ordeal, Chef Ramsay stops in for some damage control.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Chiarella's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay lends a helping hand to an Italian restaurant in Philadelphia that is hampered by a weak menu and poor service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: El Greco
programme.desc: Austin's El Greco is in dire need of an update. Chef Ramsay tries to maintain the owners' traditions while modernizing the space and improving the quality of the service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 7
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay revisits Spanish Pavillion, Kingston Cafe and La Frite to judge their progress after his initial consultations.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Fashion Farm" - The designers are taken out of the city and onto a farm. There, they are put to the test to see how innovative they can be when presented with an unusual fabric choice.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Hi's and Low's of Fashion" - The designers butt heads when they have to work in teams of two. As personalities clash in the workroom, tensions come to a head on the Runway.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Design Your Heart Out" - In this episode, the designers are challenged to create a signature dress for the Campbell's "AdDRESS Your Heart" program.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Run for Cover" - The bar is raised when the remaining designers get one of the biggest challenges in Project Runway history that comes with an unprecedented prize at stake. Big personalities begin to upset the temperature in the workroom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Little Bit of Fashion" - It's anything but child's play as the designers dig into the depths of their creativity for their "mini" challenge. But which designers will be triumphant on the runway, and which will be crying for their mommies?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hard Wear" - The designers strap on their "tool belts" to show off their "construction" skills. But as they prepare for the Runway, each designer fears they may end up in the bottom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Elements of Fashion" - The designers have to use the four elements as inspiration for their garments. But which designers will drown with their water-inspired looks or go up in flames with their fire-inspired ones?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Takin' it to the Street" - The designers look to four NYC neighborhoods for inspiration in their next Team Challenge. One designer's partner choice leads to a contentious team paring.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hey, That's My Fabric" - The designers are asked to create their own fabric as the basis for their looks.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Sew Much Pressure" - One designer's surprise announcement leads to another designer's second chance. Reeling from the shocking news, the designers have to compose themselves as they design a red carpet garment for a tough, opinionated celebrity.

programme.title: El Turista
programme.desc: Desde el campamento base del Everest hasta el desierto australiano, a través de la Patagonia o al ritmo lento del Transmongoliano, el Turista es un programa producido y presentado por Cesar Sar, quien viaja por todo el mundo a través de un gran número de países durante más de 400 días y donde nos presenta sus aventuras, nos da consejos, comparte historias y nos enseña eventos curiosos que suceden a lo largo del camino. Catorce horas de televisión con más de 260 historias cortas que saltan de un punto a otro del planeta.

programme.title: Multiple Sarcasms
programme.desc: Timothy es un arquitecto que en lugar de centrarse en su trabajo, trata de eludir la realidad refugiándose en cines y teatros. Pronto se aventura a escribir una obra de teatro basada en su propia familia. La ficción le servirá de excusa para hacer un auto-análisis de su propia vida y la de quienes lo rodean.

programme.title: Detrás De Las Cámaras

programme.title: La Promesa
programme.desc: Cada año cientos de mujeres caen en las redes de reclutadores que trafican con personas, viéndose forzadas a una vida de esclavitud sexual y laboral. Esta es la historia de Ana, Frida y Seleni, tres bellas jóvenes, engañadas bajo la promesa de alcanzar la vida soñada. Inocentes y vulnerables, con la férrea convicción de que pese a las condiciones adversas en las que viven, pueden alcanzar un mejor futuro, serán engañadas y utilizadas por personas inescrupulosas que las adentrarán en una red de prostitución de la que no podrán escapar.

programme.title: The K2 EP04
programme.desc: Yoo-jin appears in front of Jae-ha who is in crisis and an alliance is formed between them. Jae-ha goes to work at Yoo-jin's company JSS and receives a new code name, K2. His new task is observing Anna, Yoo-jin's husband and presidential candidate Jang Se-jun's hidden daughter. and the strange cohabitation between Jae-ha and Anna begins.

programme.title: The K2 EP05
programme.desc: Existing JSS agents disapprove of Jae-ha, but he, who plays an unexpected role, is becoming an indispensable person in JSS. At night, Jae-ha returns to Anna's home and performs a surveillance mission to prevent Anna from going out into the world. Checking her every night on surveillance cameras, Jae-ha unknowingly falls in love with her.

programme.title: The K2 EP06
programme.desc: Cloud Nine' is a hidden space in JSS that collects all classified information from political and business circles. Jae-ha is allowed access to the place where all JSS agents dream of entering. Yoo-jin and Jae-ha begins to delve into the secrets of the day in Iraq through 'Cloud Nine' and reveals the past of Jae-ha one by one. Meanwhile, Anna decides to visit her father, who does not meet her. Taking advantage of Jae-ha's absence, she escapes and looks back at her neighborhood. and find out clues about the death of her mother Um Hye-rin.

programme.desc: Episode 2 - The Halloween Spooky Showdown will pit videos against one another in the creepiest and kookiest cage match. This Halloween spectacular has everything from Creepy Crawlies, Crazy Costumes, Spooky Scares, to Frankenstein Fails.

programme.title: Family Funnies
programme.desc: Episode 106 - Part clip show and part comedian talking heads show, "Family Funnies" puts the fun in dysfunctional. The top family-friendly comedians speak directly to you the viewer to tell us about their funniest and most relatable family memories & milestones - as well as their parenting experiences and tips. The comedians cover family themed topics (Family Weddings, Family Vacations, Homework Rules) that are hilariously paired with similarly themed clip compilations. Warning: Results may vary, but will always be hilarious.

programme.title: AFV's Ultimate Top 1000 Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 110 - We're counting down the top 1000 videos of the year. Get ready to laugh your face off as Alfonso Ribeiro brings you the most hilarious and shocking fails of 2020.

programme.title: Top 100 Fails Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 104 - Welcome to the Top 100 Fails Countdown! On this show, the only way to win is to fail. We've got hundreds of fails, but there can be only one final fail winner.

programme.title: AFV's Top 8 Showcase Countdown: Funny Face Edition
programme.desc: Episode 102 - Guess what time it is? It's time to laugh! So sit back, relax, and get ready to LOL at top 8 videos from the AFV library. Hosted by Lili Fifield.

programme.title: Late Night Laughs
programme.desc: Episode 106 - It's one hour of pure laughs! After a long day, we know just want to sit back and relax...and what better way to do it, than with Late Night Laughs. AFV is bringing you 60 minutes of the funniest fails, pranks, pets, kids, babies, and much, much more!

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and comic Jeff Dunham takes to the stage to provide fresh comedic material with his classic.

programme.title: Joel McHale: Live from Pyongyang
programme.desc: Joel McHale brings you his first stand-up special and discusses feeding alligators to wanting to change the.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing with Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken-often-edgy characters: WALTER, PEANUT, JOSÉ JALAPEÑO.

programme.title: Tone Bell: Can't Cancel This
programme.desc: Tone simply wants to live in a world where Alaska is cold, student loans are paid, and jelly is free.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Invasion Of The Animal People
programme.desc: What do a furry monster terrorizing Lapland, a wrecked spaceship, John Carradine, and a beautiful skiing star have in common? Very little, as it turns out! Nonetheless, you’ll find them all in Invasion of the Animal People! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Relaxed Wife
programme.desc: A devoted wife teaches her husband the importance of relaxation only to have the narrator prescribe him Atarax. Bridget and Mary Jo from RiffTrax do their very best to go limp all over by flip flopping their hands and drinking coffee. Sit back and relax as they Riff this important message from the fine folks at Pfizer’s.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Blood Theater
programme.desc: Every time the Blood Theatre has opened for business, someone has died. But this time, the most incompetent theater owner in town has a good feeling about his chances! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Paper and I
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this educational short all about a little boy and his talking paper bag. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they fly off to the forests of the American South for Paper and I!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Hawk The Slayer
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this movie that resembles a Dungeons & Dragons adventure written hastily by an 8th grader. Join Mike, Kevin and Bill for a heaping helping of Jack the Palance and Hawk the Slayer!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Three Magic Words
programme.desc: Yes, Pork, the delicious substance we've been known to indulge in every now and then here at RiffTrax. And since we buy it using the titular Three Magic Words, we'll always know we've got the best pork. What are the Three Magic Words? Quality, freshness and flavor! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they are serenaded about the joys of quality, fresh, flavorful pork. Over...and over...and over again...

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Mesa Of Lost Women
programme.desc: Mesa of Lost Women! Not to be confused with the Plateau of Misplaced Babes or the Tundra of Girlfriends Who Keep Trying to Get You to Ask for Directions but You’re Simply Just Too Foolish and Proud. Join Mike, Kevin and Bill for Mesa Of Lost Women!

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Shy Guy
programme.desc: How can shyness be conquered? Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they learn how to stop being the Shy Guy in this hilarious short!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Myths of Shoplifting
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about the perils of shoplifting. Watch as teens attempt to steal makeup, records, and even a pocket calculator! Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they tackle The Myths of Shoplifting.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Omega Cop
programme.desc: Spanning exotic, post-apocalyptic locations such as The City Dump and The Bleachers at the Local High School After Field Hockey Practice Lets Out, Omega Cop is truly a feast for the senses! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Act Your Age
programme.desc: A classic of the late '40's, "authority figure shames a student" genre, Act Your Age is a window into the soul... of Jim. Join Mike, Kevin and Bill for Act Your Age!
